source_name: Seroprevalence and seroconversion rates to SARS-CoV-2 in interns, residents, and medical doctors in a University Hospital in Bogota, Colombia
summary: Researchers from Pontificia Universidad Javeriana studied healthcare workers in Bogota, Columbia and found a seroprevalence of 8.26%.

source_name: Seroreactivity to SARS-CoV-2 in individuals attending a university campus in Bogotá Colombia
summary: Universidad de Los Andes studied individuals working at Universidad de Los Andes (n = 237) and found 13.5% seroprevalence

source_name: Seroprevalence and seroconversions for SARS-CoV-2 infections in workers at Bogota Airport, Colombia, 2020
summary: Researchers at the Instituto Nacional de Salud studied workers at the Bogota Airport, Colombia, and found an adjusted seroprevalence of 16.03% (n=212).

source_name: Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 Seroprevalence Among Adults in a Tropical City of the Caribbean Area, Colombia: Are We Much Closer to Herd Immunity Than Developed Countries?.
summary: Researchers from the Universidad de Córdoba randomly sampled 1368 from the general population of Monteria, Colombia, and found a 55.3% seroprevalence.

source_name: Performance of rapid IgM-IgG combined antibody tests in the occupational surveillance of COVID-19 in Colombian enterprises.
